verses.text: But these are they that are by the way side where the word is sown; and when they hear, Satan immediately comes and takes away the word that is sown in them.

sinaiticus.text: And these are they in like manner that were sown on the rocky places; who when they hear the word immediately with joy receive it;

verses.text: And these are they in like manner that were sown on the rocky places; who when they hear the word immediately with joy receive it;

sinaiticus.text: And yet they have no root in themselves, but endure for a time: then when affliction or persecution arises because of the word they immediately take offense.

verses.text: And yet they have no root in themselves, but endure for a time: then when affliction or persecution arises because of the word they immediately take offense.

sinaiticus.text: And others are they that were sown over the thorns: these are they that hear the word,

verses.text: And others are they that were sown over the thorns: these are they that hear the word,

sinaiticus.text: And the cares of the age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires about other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

verses.text: And the cares of the age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires about other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

sinaiticus.text: And they that were sown on good ground are those who hear the word and receive it, and bring forth fruit in thirties, and in sixties, and in hundreds.

verses.text: And they that were sown on good ground are those who hear the word and receive it, and bring forth fruit in thirties, and in sixties, and in hundreds.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Is a lamp brought that it may be put under the measure or under the bed? Is it not brought that it may be put on the lampstand?

verses.text: And he said to them: Is a lamp brought that it may be put under the measure or under the bed? Is it not brought that it may be put on the lampstand?

sinaiticus.text: For there is nothing hid, unless that it may be made manifest: nor was any thing concealed, but that it might come into open view.

verses.text: For there is nothing hid, unless that it may be made manifest: nor was any thing concealed, but that it might come into open view.

sinaiticus.text: If any one has ears to hear, let him hear.

verses.text: If any one has ears to hear, let him hear.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Take heed what you hear. With what measure you measure it shall be measured to you, and more shall be given to you.

verses.text: And he said to them: Take heed what you hear. With what measure you measure it shall be measured to you, and more shall be given to you.

sinaiticus.text: For he that has, to him shall be given; and he that has not, even that which he has shall be taken from him.

verses.text: For he that has, to him shall be given; and he that has not, even that which he has shall be taken from him.

sinaiticus.text: And he said: So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should sow seed upon the earth,

verses.text: And he said: So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should sow seed upon the earth,

sinaiticus.text: And should sleep and awake night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he knows not how.

verses.text: And should sleep and awake night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he knows not how.

sinaiticus.text: The earth of its own accord brings forth fruit, first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.

verses.text: The earth of its own accord brings forth fruit, first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.

sinaiticus.text: But when the fruit shall have presented itself, immediately he sends forth the sickle, because the harvest is ready.76

verses.text: But when the fruit shall have presented itself, immediately he sends forth the sickle, because the harvest is ready.76

sinaiticus.text: And he said: How shall we liken the kingdom of God, or with what parable shall we set it forth?

verses.text: And he said: How shall we liken the kingdom of God, or with what parable shall we set it forth?

sinaiticus.text: It is like a grain of mustard, which, when it is sown on the earth, is less than all the seeds that are on the earth;

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard, which, when it is sown on the earth, is less than all the seeds that are on the earth;

sinaiticus.text: And yet when it is sown, it springs up and becomes greater than all garden-plants, and; makes great branches, so that the birds of heaven can lodge under its shadow.

verses.text: And yet when it is sown, it springs up and becomes greater than all garden-plants, and; makes great branches, so that the birds of heaven can lodge under its shadow.

sinaiticus.text: And with many such parables spoke he the word to them, as they were able to hear;

verses.text: And with many such parables spoke he the word to them, as they were able to hear;

sinaiticus.text: But without a parable spoke he not to them; but privately he explained all things to his disciples.

verses.text: But without a parable spoke he not to them; but privately he explained all things to his disciples.

sinaiticus.text: And on that day when it was evening he says to them: Let us pass over to the other side.

verses.text: And on that day when it was evening he says to them: Let us pass over to the other side.

sinaiticus.text: And leaving the multitude they took him as he was in the ship, and there were also other ships with him.

verses.text: And leaving the multitude they took him as he was in the ship, and there were also other ships with him.

sinaiticus.text: And there came a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that the ship was now full.

verses.text: And there came a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that the ship was now full.

sinaiticus.text: And he was sleeping in the prow on the boat-cushion; and they awoke him and said to him: Teacher, carest thou not that we perish?

verses.text: And he was sleeping in the prow on the boat-cushion; and they awoke him and said to him: Teacher, carest thou not that we perish?

sinaiticus.text: And he awoke and rebuked the wind and said to the sea: Peace be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

verses.text: And he awoke and rebuked the wind and said to the sea: Peace be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Why are you so fearful? How have you no faith?

verses.text: And he said to them: Why are you so fearful? How have you no faith?

sinaiticus.text: And they were afraid with great fear, and said one to another: Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?

verses.text: And they were afraid with great fear, and said one to another: Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?

sinaiticus.text: And they came to the other side of the sea to the, country of the Gadarenes.

verses.text: And they came to the other side of the sea to the, country of the Gadarenes.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had come out of the ship, immediately there met him a man from the tombs with an unclean spirit,

verses.text: And when he had come out of the ship, immediately there met him a man from the tombs with an unclean spirit,

sinaiticus.text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs; and not even with a chain was any one any longer able to bind him,

verses.text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs; and not even with a chain was any one any longer able to bind him,

sinaiticus.text: Because he had often been bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been pulled asunder by him and the fetters had been broken; and no one was able to subdue him;

verses.text: Because he had often been bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been pulled asunder by him and the fetters had been broken; and no one was able to subdue him;

sinaiticus.text: And always night and day among the tombs and in the mountains he was crying out and cutting himself with stones.

verses.text: And always night and day among the tombs and in the mountains he was crying out and cutting himself with stones.

sinaiticus.text: And seeing Jesus at a distance he ran and worshipped him;

verses.text: And seeing Jesus at a distance he ran and worshipped him;

sinaiticus.text: and crying out with a loud voice, he said: What have I to do with thee, Jesus, Son of God most high? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.

verses.text: and crying out with a loud voice, he said: What have I to do with thee, Jesus, Son of God most high? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.

sinaiticus.text: And he asked him: What is thy name? And he said to him: My name is legion, for we are many.

verses.text: And he asked him: What is thy name? And he said to him: My name is legion, for we are many.

sinaiticus.text: And they besought him much that he would not send them out of the country.

verses.text: And they besought him much that he would not send them out of the country.

sinaiticus.text: But there was there near the mountain a great herd of swine feeding;

verses.text: But there was there near the mountain a great herd of swine feeding;

sinaiticus.text: And they besought him, saying: Send us to the swine that we may enter into them.

verses.text: And they besought him, saying: Send us to the swine that we may enter into them.

sinaiticus.text: And he permitted them. And the unclean spirits came out and entered into the swine; and the herd, about two thousand, rushed down the steep into the sea, and were choked in the sea.

verses.text: And he permitted them. And the unclean spirits came out and entered into the swine; and the herd, about two thousand, rushed down the steep into the sea, and were choked in the sea.

sinaiticus.text: And those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country; and they came I to see what it was that had been done.

verses.text: And those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country; and they came I to see what it was that had been done.

sinaiticus.text: And they come to Jesus and see him that had the demon, sitting, clothed and in his right mind, him that had had the legion, and they were afraid.

verses.text: And they come to Jesus and see him that had the demon, sitting, clothed and in his right mind, him that had had the legion, and they were afraid.

sinaiticus.text: And they that had seen told them how it had happened to the demon and concerning the swine.

verses.text: And they that had seen told them how it had happened to the demon and concerning the swine.

sinaiticus.text: And they began to beseech him to depart from their borders.

verses.text: And they began to beseech him to depart from their borders.

sinaiticus.text: And as he was entering the ship, he that had been possessed with the demon besought him that he might be with him.

verses.text: And as he was entering the ship, he that had been possessed with the demon besought him that he might be with him.

sinaiticus.text: And he permitted him not, but said to him: Go to thy house to thy own, and tell them what things the Lord has done for thee, and has had mercy on thee.

verses.text: And he permitted him not, but said to him: Go to thy house to thy own, and tell them what things the Lord has done for thee, and has had mercy on thee.

sinaiticus.text: And he went away, and began to proclaim in Decapolis what things Jesus had done for him; and all were astonished.

verses.text: And he went away, and began to proclaim in Decapolis what things Jesus had done for him; and all were astonished.

sinaiticus.text: And when Jesus had again passed over in the ship to the other side, a great multitude came together to him, and he was by the sea.

verses.text: And when Jesus had again passed over in the ship to the other side, a great multitude came together to him, and he was by the sea.

sinaiticus.text: And there comes one of the rulers of the synagogue, named Jairus; and seeing him he falls at his feet,

verses.text: And there comes one of the rulers of the synagogue, named Jairus; and seeing him he falls at his feet,

sinaiticus.text: and beseeches him much, saying: My little daughter is at the point of death, I pray that thou wouldst come and lay thy hand on her, that she may be saved and live.

verses.text: and beseeches him much, saying: My little daughter is at the point of death, I pray that thou wouldst come and lay thy hand on her, that she may be saved and live.

sinaiticus.text: And he went away with him; and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him.

verses.text: And he went away with him; and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him.

sinaiticus.text: And a woman that had had an issue of blood for twelve years,

verses.text: And a woman that had had an issue of blood for twelve years,

sinaiticus.text: And had suffered many things under many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was in no way benefited, but rather grew worse.

verses.text: And had suffered many things under many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was in no way benefited, but rather grew worse.

sinaiticus.text: Hearing of the things concerning Jesus, came behind in the multitude, and touched his clothes;

verses.text: Hearing of the things concerning Jesus, came behind in the multitude, and touched his clothes;

sinaiticus.text: For she said: If I may touch even his clothes, I shall be saved.

verses.text: For she said: If I may touch even his clothes, I shall be saved.

sinaiticus.text: And immediately the fountain of her blood dried up, and she knew in her body that she was restored to health from that scourge.78

verses.text: And immediately the fountain of her blood dried up, and she knew in her body that she was restored to health from that scourge.78

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus immediately perceiving in himself that power had gone forth from him, turned about in the multitude and said: Who touched my clothes?

verses.text: And Jesus immediately perceiving in himself that power had gone forth from him, turned about in the multitude and said: Who touched my clothes?

sinaiticus.text: And his disciples said to him: Seest thou the multitude thronging thee and sayest thou: Who touched me?

verses.text: And his disciples said to him: Seest thou the multitude thronging thee and sayest thou: Who touched me?

sinaiticus.text: And he looked around to see her that had done this.

verses.text: And he looked around to see her that had done this.

sinaiticus.text: But the woman being afraid and trembling, knowing what had been done for her, came and fell before him and told him all the truth.

verses.text: But the woman being afraid and trembling, knowing what had been done for her, came and fell before him and told him all the truth.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to her: Daughter, thy faith has saved thee: go in peace, and be well of thy scourge.

verses.text: And he said to her: Daughter, thy faith has saved thee: go in peace, and be well of thy scourge.

sinaiticus.text: While he was yet speaking there came some from the house of the ruler of the synagogue, saying: Thy daughter is dead, why trouble the Teacher further?

verses.text: While he was yet speaking there came some from the house of the ruler of the synagogue, saying: Thy daughter is dead, why trouble the Teacher further?

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus, disregarding the word that was spoken, said to the ruler of the synagogue: Fear not, only believe.

verses.text: But Jesus, disregarding the word that was spoken, said to the ruler of the synagogue: Fear not, only believe.

sinaiticus.text: And he permitted no one to follow with him but Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

verses.text: And he permitted no one to follow with him but Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

sinaiticus.text: And they come to the house of the ruler of the synagogue; and he sees a tumult, and those who wept and bewailed much;

verses.text: And they come to the house of the ruler of the synagogue; and he sees a tumult, and those who wept and bewailed much;

sinaiticus.text: And entering in he says to them: Why make a tumult and weep? The child is not dead, but sleeps.

verses.text: And entering in he says to them: Why make a tumult and weep? The child is not dead, but sleeps.

sinaiticus.text: And they derided him. But he, having put them all out, takes the father of the child, and the mother, and those with him, and goes in where the child was.

verses.text: And they derided him. But he, having put them all out, takes the father of the child, and the mother, and those with him, and goes in where the child was.

sinaiticus.text: And he took the child by the hand and said to her: Talitha kumi, which is translated: Maiden, I say to thee, arise.

verses.text: And he took the child by the hand and said to her: Talitha kumi, which is translated: Maiden, I say to thee, arise.

sinaiticus.text: And the maiden immediately rose up and walked; for she was twelve years old. And they were immediately astonished with great astonishment.

verses.text: And the maiden immediately rose up and walked; for she was twelve years old. And they were immediately astonished with great astonishment.

sinaiticus.text: And he charged them much that no one should know this and commanded that there should be given her to eat.

verses.text: And he charged them much that no one should know this and commanded that there should be given her to eat.

sinaiticus.text: And he went out thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples followed him.

verses.text: And he went out thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples followed him.

sinaiticus.text: And when the sabbath had come he began to teach in the synagogue; and many hearing were astonished, saying: Whence has this man these things, and what the wisdom that is given to this man? and are such mighty deeds done through his hands?

verses.text: And when the sabbath had come he began to teach in the synagogue; and many hearing were astonished, saying: Whence has this man these things, and what the wisdom that is given to this man? and are such mighty deeds done through his hands?

sinaiticus.text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James and Joses and Judah and Simon? And are not his sisters here with us?

verses.text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James and Joses and Judah and Simon? And are not his sisters here with us?

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to them: A prophet is not without honor, unless in his own country, and among his relatives, and in his own house.

verses.text: And Jesus said to them: A prophet is not without honor, unless in his own country, and among his relatives, and in his own house.

sinaiticus.text: And he was able to do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick persons and cured them.

verses.text: And he was able to do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick persons and cured them.

sinaiticus.text: And he wondered because of their unbelief. And he went about the villages round about teaching.

verses.text: And he wondered because of their unbelief. And he went about the villages round about teaching.

sinaiticus.text: And he called to him the twelve, and began to send them forth two and two; and gave them authority over unclean spirits;

verses.text: And he called to him the twelve, and began to send them forth two and two; and gave them authority over unclean spirits;

sinaiticus.text: And charged them to take nothing for the journey but a staff only; no bread, no bag, no brass in the girdle,

verses.text: And charged them to take nothing for the journey but a staff only; no bread, no bag, no brass in the girdle,

sinaiticus.text: But be shod with sandals: and put not on two coats.

verses.text: But be shod with sandals: and put not on two coats.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Wherever you enter a house, there abide till you go forth thence.

verses.text: And he said to them: Wherever you enter a house, there abide till you go forth thence.

sinaiticus.text: And whatever place shall not have received you nor heard you, when you go out thence, shake off the dust that is under your feet, for a testimony against them.

verses.text: And whatever place shall not have received you nor heard you, when you go out thence, shake off the dust that is under your feet, for a testimony against them.

sinaiticus.text: And they went forth and preached that men should repent;

verses.text: And they went forth and preached that men should repent;

sinaiticus.text: and they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many sick and cured them.

verses.text: and they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many sick and cured them.

sinaiticus.text: And Herod the king heard, for his name had become known, and said: John the Baptist has risen from the dead, and for this reason the powers are active within him.

verses.text: And Herod the king heard, for his name had become known, and said: John the Baptist has risen from the dead, and for this reason the powers are active within him.

sinaiticus.text: But others said: It is Elijah; but others said: He is a prophet like one of the prophets.

verses.text: But others said: It is Elijah; but others said: He is a prophet like one of the prophets.

sinaiticus.text: But Herod, when he heard, said: John whom I beheaded, he has risen.

verses.text: But Herod, when he heard, said: John whom I beheaded, he has risen.

sinaiticus.text: For Herod himself had sent and taken John, and bound him in prison because of Herodias the wife of his brother Philip, for he had married her.

verses.text: For Herod himself had sent and taken John, and bound him in prison because of Herodias the wife of his brother Philip, for he had married her.

sinaiticus.text: For John said to Herod: It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.

verses.text: For John said to Herod: It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.

sinaiticus.text: And Herodias was angry with him, and desired to kill him, and was not able.

verses.text: And Herodias was angry with him, and desired to kill him, and was not able.

sinaiticus.text: For Herod feared John, knowing him to be a righteous and holy man, and he kept him in safety, and hearing him he was much perplexed, and heard him with pleasure.

verses.text: For Herod feared John, knowing him to be a righteous and holy man, and he kept him in safety, and hearing him he was much perplexed, and heard him with pleasure.

sinaiticus.text: And a suitable time having come, when Herod on his birthday had made a supper for his great men, and the officers of thousands, and the first men of Galilee;

verses.text: And a suitable time having come, when Herod on his birthday had made a supper for his great men, and the officers of thousands, and the first men of Galilee;

sinaiticus.text: and the daughter of the same Herodias having come in and danced, she pleased Herod and those that reclined with him at table; and the king said to the maiden: Ask of me whatever thou wilt, and I will give thee.80

verses.text: and the daughter of the same Herodias having come in and danced, she pleased Herod and those that reclined with him at table; and the king said to the maiden: Ask of me whatever thou wilt, and I will give thee.80

sinaiticus.text: And he swore to her: Whatever thou shalt ask I will give thee to the half of my kingdom.

verses.text: And he swore to her: Whatever thou shalt ask I will give thee to the half of my kingdom.

sinaiticus.text: And she went out and said to her mother: What shall I ask? And she said: The head of John the Baptist.

verses.text: And she went out and said to her mother: What shall I ask? And she said: The head of John the Baptist.

sinaiticus.text: And coming in immediately with haste to the king, she asked, saying: I will that thou at once give me in a dish the head of John the Baptist.

verses.text: And coming in immediately with haste to the king, she asked, saying: I will that thou at once give me in a dish the head of John the Baptist.

sinaiticus.text: And the king though he became very sad, because of the oaths and; those that reclined at table with him would not reject her.

verses.text: And the king though he became very sad, because of the oaths and; those that reclined at table with him would not reject her.

sinaiticus.text: And the king immediately sent an executioner and ordered to bring his head.

verses.text: And the king immediately sent an executioner and ordered to bring his head.

sinaiticus.text: And he went and beheaded him in the prison, and brought his head in a dish, and gave it to the maiden; and the maiden gave it to her mother.

verses.text: And he went and beheaded him in the prison, and brought his head in a dish, and gave it to the maiden; and the maiden gave it to her mother.

sinaiticus.text: And his disciples heard it and came and took away his corpse, and laid him in a sepulcher.

verses.text: And his disciples heard it and came and took away his corpse, and laid him in a sepulcher.

sinaiticus.text: And the apostles came together to Jesus, and told him all things that they had done and taught.

verses.text: And the apostles came together to Jesus, and told him all things that they had done and taught.

sinaiticus.text: And he says to them: Do you yourselves come apart to a desert place, and rest a little. For many were coming and going, and they had leisure not even to eat.

verses.text: And he says to them: Do you yourselves come apart to a desert place, and rest a little. For many were coming and going, and they had leisure not even to eat.

sinaiticus.text: And they went away by ship to a desert place apart.

verses.text: And they went away by ship to a desert place apart.

sinaiticus.text: And many saw them going and knew them, and ran thither on foot from all the cities, and outwent them.

verses.text: And many saw them going and knew them, and ran thither on foot from all the cities, and outwent them.

sinaiticus.text: And coming out he saw a great multitude, and was moved with pity for them, because they were as sheep that had no shepherd, and began to teach them many things.

verses.text: And coming out he saw a great multitude, and was moved with pity for them, because they were as sheep that had no shepherd, and began to teach them many things.

sinaiticus.text: And as much time had already passed, his disciples came and said: The place is desert, and already much time is spent:

verses.text: And as much time had already passed, his disciples came and said: The place is desert, and already much time is spent:

sinaiticus.text: dismiss them, that they may go into the country and villages round about and buy for themselves what they may eat.

verses.text: dismiss them, that they may go into the country and villages round about and buy for themselves what they may eat.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered and said to them: Do you give them to eat. And they say to him: Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them to eat?

verses.text: But he answered and said to them: Do you give them to eat. And they say to him: Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them to eat?

sinaiticus.text: But he says to them: How many loaves have you? Go, see. And having learned they say: Five and two fishes.

verses.text: But he says to them: How many loaves have you? Go, see. And having learned they say: Five and two fishes.

sinaiticus.text: And he ordered them that all should recline by table-parties on the green grass.

sinaiticus.text: And having taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven and blessed; and broke the loaves, and gave to the disciples to set before them; and the two fishes he divided among all.

verses.text: And having taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven and blessed; and broke the loaves, and gave to the disciples to set before them; and the two fishes he divided among all.

sinaiticus.text: And those that had eaten the loaves were five thousand men.

verses.text: And those that had eaten the loaves were five thousand men.

verses.text: And when evening had come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and himself alone on the land.

sinaiticus.text: And seeing them toiling in rowing, for the wind was against them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them walking on the sea. And he intended to pass by them.

verses.text: And seeing them toiling in rowing, for the wind was against them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them walking on the sea. And he intended to pass by them.

sinaiticus.text: and the seven left no offspring. Last of all the woman also died.

verses.text: and the seven left no offspring. Last of all the woman also died.

sinaiticus.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, of which of them shall she be the wife? For the seven had her as a wife.

verses.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, of which of them shall she be the wife? For the seven had her as a wife.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to them: Do you not therefore err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God?

verses.text: Jesus said to them: Do you not therefore err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God?

sinaiticus.text: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as angels in the heavens.

verses.text: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as angels in the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: But concerning the dead, that they do rise. Have you not read in the book of Moses, at the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying: I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob?

verses.text: But concerning the dead, that they do rise. Have you not read in the book of Moses, at the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying: I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob?

sinaiticus.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You greatly err.

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You greatly err.

sinaiticus.text: And one of the scribes came forward as he had heard them disputing, and seeing that he had answered them well, he asked him: Which is the first commandment of all?

verses.text: And one of the scribes came forward as he had heard them disputing, and seeing that he had answered them well, he asked him: Which is the first commandment of all?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered him: The first is: Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is one Lord;

verses.text: Jesus answered him: The first is: Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is one Lord;

sinaiticus.text: and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart, and with thy whole soul, and with thy whole mind, and with thy whole strength.94

verses.text: and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart, and with thy whole soul, and with thy whole mind, and with thy whole strength.94

sinaiticus.text: The second is this: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself. There is no other commandment greater than these.

verses.text: The second is this: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself. There is no other commandment greater than these.

sinaiticus.text: And the scribe said to him: Teacher, in truth hast thou well said that there is One, and there is no other beside him.

verses.text: And the scribe said to him: Teacher, in truth hast thou well said that there is One, and there is no other beside him.

sinaiticus.text: And to love him with the whole heart, and with the whole understanding, and with the whole strength, and to love one’s neighbor as himself is more than all whole burnt-offerings and sacrifices.

verses.text: And to love him with the whole heart, and with the whole understanding, and with the whole strength, and to love one’s neighbor as himself is more than all whole burnt-offerings and sacrifices.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus, seeing him that he had answered with understanding, said to him: Not far art thou from the kingdom of God. And no one any more ventured to ask him a question.

verses.text: And Jesus, seeing him that he had answered with understanding, said to him: Not far art thou from the kingdom of God. And no one any more ventured to ask him a question.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus answered and said, while teaching in the temple: How say the scribes that Christ is the son of David?

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said, while teaching in the temple: How say the scribes that Christ is the son of David?

sinaiticus.text: David himself said in the Holy Spirit: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand till I make thy enemies thy footstool.

verses.text: David himself said in the Holy Spirit: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand till I make thy enemies thy footstool.

sinaiticus.text: David himself calls him Lord; and whence is he his son? And the great multitude heard him with pleasure.

verses.text: David himself calls him Lord; and whence is he his son? And the great multitude heard him with pleasure.

sinaiticus.text: And in his teaching he said; Beware of the scribes, who delight to walk about in robes, and love salutations in the markets,

verses.text: And in his teaching he said; Beware of the scribes, who delight to walk about in robes, and love salutations in the markets,

sinaiticus.text: And the first seats in the synagogues, and the first reclining places at suppers:

verses.text: And the first seats in the synagogues, and the first reclining places at suppers:

sinaiticus.text: Who eat up widow’s houses and for a pretext make long prayers: these shall receive greater condemnation.

verses.text: Who eat up widow’s houses and for a pretext make long prayers: these shall receive greater condemnation.

sinaiticus.text: And as he sat opposite the treasury, he was observing how the multitude threw money into the treasury; and many rich men threw in much;

verses.text: And as he sat opposite the treasury, he was observing how the multitude threw money into the treasury; and many rich men threw in much;

sinaiticus.text: And there came one poor widow and threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

verses.text: And there came one poor widow and threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

sinaiticus.text: And calling his disciples to him, he said to them: Verily I say to you that this poor widow has thrown in more than all that are throwing into the treasury;

verses.text: And calling his disciples to him, he said to them: Verily I say to you that this poor widow has thrown in more than all that are throwing into the treasury;

sinaiticus.text: For all have thrown in out of their abundance; but she out of her poverty has thrown in all that she had, her whole living.

verses.text: For all have thrown in out of their abundance; but she out of her poverty has thrown in all that she had, her whole living.

sinaiticus.text: And as he was going out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him: Teacher, see what manner of stones, and what manner of buildings.

verses.text: And as he was going out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him: Teacher, see what manner of stones, and what manner of buildings.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to him: Seest thou these great buildings? There shall not be left a stone upon a stone that shall not be thrown down.

verses.text: And Jesus said to him: Seest thou these great buildings? There shall not be left a stone upon a stone that shall not be thrown down.

sinaiticus.text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives opposite to the temple. Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately:

verses.text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives opposite to the temple. Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately:

sinaiticus.text: Tell us, when shall these things be? And what the sign when all

verses.text: Tell us, when shall these things be? And what the sign when all

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus began to say to them: See that no one deceive you.

verses.text: And Jesus began to say to them: See that no one deceive you.

sinaiticus.text: Many shall come in my name, saying: I am he, and shall deceive many.

verses.text: Many shall come in my name, saying: I am he, and shall deceive many.

sinaiticus.text: But when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, be not troubled: they must take place, but not yet the end.

verses.text: But when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, be not troubled: they must take place, but not yet the end.

sinaiticus.text: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: there shall be earthquakes in various places, there shall be famines.

verses.text: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: there shall be earthquakes in various places, there shall be famines.

sinaiticus.text: These are the beginning of pains. But see you to yourselves: they shall deliver you up to councils, and in synagogues you shall be beaten, and before governors and kings shall you stand for my sake, for a testimony to them.

verses.text: These are the beginning of pains. But see you to yourselves: they shall deliver you up to councils, and in synagogues you shall be beaten, and before governors and kings shall you stand for my sake, for a testimony to them.

sinaiticus.text: And among all nations shall the gospel first be preached.

verses.text: And among all nations shall the gospel first be preached.

sinaiticus.text: And when they lead you delivering you up, be not anxious beforehand what you shall speak; but whatever shall be given you in that hour, this speak; for you are not the speakers, but the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: And when they lead you delivering you up, be not anxious beforehand what you shall speak; but whatever shall be given you in that hour, this speak; for you are not the speakers, but the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: And brother shall deliver up brother to death, and the father the child, and children shall rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.

verses.text: And brother shall deliver up brother to death, and the father the child, and children shall rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.

sinaiticus.text: And you shall be hated by all because of my name; but he that endures to the end, he shall be saved.

verses.text: And you shall be hated by all because of my name; but he that endures to the end, he shall be saved.

sinaiticus.text: But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those in Judea flee to the mountains:

verses.text: But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those in Judea flee to the mountains:

sinaiticus.text: And he that is on the housetop let him not come down nor go in to take any thing from his house:

verses.text: And he that is on the housetop let him not come down nor go in to take any thing from his house:

sinaiticus.text: And he that is in the field let him not turn back to take his mantle.

verses.text: And he that is in the field let him not turn back to take his mantle.

sinaiticus.text: But alas for them that are with child, and them that give suck in those days.

verses.text: But alas for them that are with child, and them that give suck in those days.

sinaiticus.text: But pray that it may not take place in winter.

verses.text: But pray that it may not take place in winter.

sinaiticus.text: For those days shall be affliction, such as has not been from the beginning of the creation, which God created, till now, and shall not be.

verses.text: For those days shall be affliction, such as has not been from the beginning of the creation, which God created, till now, and shall not be.

sinaiticus.text: And unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but because of the elect whom he has chosen he has shortened the days.

verses.text: And unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but because of the elect whom he has chosen he has shortened the days.

sinaiticus.text: And then, if any one say to you: Lo, here is Christ, lo there; believe not.

verses.text: And then, if any one say to you: Lo, here is Christ, lo there; believe not.

sinaiticus.text: But false Christs, and false prophets shall arise, and shall do signs and wonders in order to deceive, if possible, the elect.

verses.text: But false Christs, and false prophets shall arise, and shall do signs and wonders in order to deceive, if possible, the elect.

sinaiticus.text: But do you beware: I have told you all things beforehand.

verses.text: But do you beware: I have told you all things beforehand.

sinaiticus.text: But in those days after that affliction the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,96

verses.text: But in those days after that affliction the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,96

sinaiticus.text: And the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers which are in the heavens shall be shaken.

verses.text: And the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers which are in the heavens shall be shaken.

sinaiticus.text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

verses.text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

sinaiticus.text: And then shall he send the angels and gather the elect from the four winds, from the end of earth to the end of heaven.

verses.text: And then shall he send the angels and gather the elect from the four winds, from the end of earth to the end of heaven.

sinaiticus.text: But learn the parable from the fig-tree. When its branch has now become tender and put forth leaves, you know that summer is near:

verses.text: But learn the parable from the fig-tree. When its branch has now become tender and put forth leaves, you know that summer is near:

sinaiticus.text: So also you, when you see these things taking place, know that it is near, at the doors.

verses.text: So also you, when you see these things taking place, know that it is near, at the doors.

sinaiticus.text: Verily I say to you that this generation shall not pass away, till all these things shall have been accomplished.

verses.text: Verily I say to you that this generation shall not pass away, till all these things shall have been accomplished.

sinaiticus.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

sinaiticus.text: But of that day or the hour no one knows, neither the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but the Father.

verses.text: But of that day or the hour no one knows, neither the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but the Father.

sinaiticus.text: Beware, watch; for you know not when the time is.

verses.text: Beware, watch; for you know not when the time is.

sinaiticus.text: As a man, going to another country, left his house, and gave to his servants authority, to each one his work, and commanded the doorkeeper to watch.

verses.text: As a man, going to another country, left his house, and gave to his servants authority, to each one his work, and commanded the doorkeeper to watch.

sinaiticus.text: Watch therefore; for you know not when the lord of the house comes, whether in the evening, or at midnight, or at cock-crowing, or in the morning:

verses.text: Watch therefore; for you know not when the lord of the house comes, whether in the evening, or at midnight, or at cock-crowing, or in the morning:

sinaiticus.text: Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.

verses.text: Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.

sinaiticus.text: But what I say to you, I say to all. Watch.

verses.text: But what I say to you, I say to all. Watch.

sinaiticus.text: But after two days came the passover and the unleavened bread; and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft and put him to death;

verses.text: But after two days came the passover and the unleavened bread; and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft and put him to death;

sinaiticus.text: For they said: Not on the feast, lest there be a tumult of the people.

verses.text: For they said: Not on the feast, lest there be a tumult of the people.

sinaiticus.text: And while he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he reclined at table there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of pure spikenard, very costly: after breaking the box she poured it on his head.

verses.text: And while he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he reclined at table there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of pure spikenard, very costly: after breaking the box she poured it on his head.

sinaiticus.text: But some expressed displeasure among themselves: Why was this waste of the ointment made?

verses.text: But some expressed displeasure among themselves: Why was this waste of the ointment made?

sinaiticus.text: For this ointment could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor; and they murmured against her.

verses.text: For this ointment could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor; and they murmured against her.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus said: Let her alone: why give her trouble? a good work

verses.text: But Jesus said: Let her alone: why give her trouble? a good work

sinaiticus.text: For the poor you have always with you, and when you will you can do them good; but me you have not always.

verses.text: For the poor you have always with you, and when you will you can do them good; but me you have not always.

sinaiticus.text: What she could she has done: she has come beforehand to anoint my body for the burial.

verses.text: What she could she has done: she has come beforehand to anoint my body for the burial.

sinaiticus.text: And verily I say to you, wherever the gospel shall be preached in the whole world, this also that she has done shall be told for a memorial of her.

verses.text: And verily I say to you, wherever the gospel shall be preached in the whole world, this also that she has done shall be told for a memorial of her.

sinaiticus.text: And Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests that he might deliver him up to them.

verses.text: And Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests that he might deliver him up to them.

sinaiticus.text: And when they heard it they were glad, and promised to give him money; and he sought how he might conveniently deliver him up.

verses.text: And when they heard it they were glad, and promised to give him money; and he sought how he might conveniently deliver him up.

sinaiticus.text: And on the first day of unleavened bread, when they killed the passover, his disciples say to him: Where wilt thou that we go and make ready that thou mayest eat the passover?

verses.text: And on the first day of unleavened bread, when they killed the passover, his disciples say to him: Where wilt thou that we go and make ready that thou mayest eat the passover?

sinaiticus.text: And he sends two of his disciples and says to them: Go into the city, and there shall meet you a man carrying a pitcher of water; follow him,

verses.text: And he sends two of his disciples and says to them: Go into the city, and there shall meet you a man carrying a pitcher of water; follow him,

sinaiticus.text: and wherever he enters, say to the master of the house that the Teacher says: Where is my guest-chamber where I may eat the passover with my disciples?

verses.text: and wherever he enters, say to the master of the house that the Teacher says: Where is my guest-chamber where I may eat the passover with my disciples?

sinaiticus.text: And he will show you a large upper room furnished, ready: there prepare for us.

verses.text: And he will show you a large upper room furnished, ready: there prepare for us.

sinaiticus.text: And the disciples went out, and came into the city, and found as he had said to them, and made ready the passover.

verses.text: And the disciples went out, and came into the city, and found as he had said to them, and made ready the passover.

sinaiticus.text: And when it was evening he comes with the twelve.

verses.text: And when it was evening he comes with the twelve.

sinaiticus.text: And as they reclined at table and ate, Jesus said: Verily I say to you that one of you shall deliver me up, he that eats with me.

verses.text: And as they reclined at table and ate, Jesus said: Verily I say to you that one of you shall deliver me up, he that eats with me.

sinaiticus.text: They began to be sad and to say to him one by one: Is it I?

verses.text: They began to be sad and to say to him one by one: Is it I?

sinaiticus.text: But he said to them: one of the twelve, he that dips with me into the dish.

verses.text: But he said to them: one of the twelve, he that dips with me into the dish.

sinaiticus.text: For the Son of man goes, as it is written of him; but alas for that man by whom the Son of man is delivered up: good were it for that man if he had not been born.

verses.text: For the Son of man goes, as it is written of him; but alas for that man by whom the Son of man is delivered up: good were it for that man if he had not been born.

sinaiticus.text: And as they ate, having taken bread and blessed, he broke and gave to them and said: Take: this is my body.

verses.text: And as they ate, having taken bread and blessed, he broke and gave to them and said: Take: this is my body.

sinaiticus.text: And having taken the cup and given thanks, he gave to them; and they all drank of it.

verses.text: And having taken the cup and given thanks, he gave to them; and they all drank of it.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.

verses.text: And he said to them: This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.

sinaiticus.text: Verily I say to you that I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, till that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.

verses.text: Verily I say to you that I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, till that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: And they sung a hymn and went out into the mount of Olives.

verses.text: And they sung a hymn and went out into the mount of Olives.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus says to them: You all shall be offended; for it is written: I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.98

verses.text: And Jesus says to them: You all shall be offended; for it is written: I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.98

sinaiticus.text: But after I have risen I will go before you into Galilee.

verses.text: But after I have risen I will go before you into Galilee.

sinaiticus.text: But Peter said to him: Though all should be offended, yet not I.

verses.text: But Peter said to him: Though all should be offended, yet not I.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus says to him: Verily I say to thee that thou, this day, on this night, before a cock shall have crowed twice, thou shalt deny me three times.

verses.text: And Jesus says to him: Verily I say to thee that thou, this day, on this night, before a cock shall have crowed twice, thou shalt deny me three times.

sinaiticus.text: But he said with vehemence: Though it should be necessary for me to die with thee, I will in no way deny thee. And in like manner also said they all.

verses.text: But he said with vehemence: Though it should be necessary for me to die with thee, I will in no way deny thee. And in like manner also said they all.

sinaiticus.text: And they come to a place, the name of which is Gethsemane; and he says to his disciples: Sit here till I pray.

verses.text: And they come to a place, the name of which is Gethsemane; and he says to his disciples: Sit here till I pray.

sinaiticus.text: And he took with him Peter and James and John, and began to be greatly amazed and in anguish,

verses.text: And he took with him Peter and James and John, and began to be greatly amazed and in anguish,

sinaiticus.text: And said to them: My soul is encompassed with sorrow even to death: remain here and watch.

verses.text: And said to them: My soul is encompassed with sorrow even to death: remain here and watch.

sinaiticus.text: And going forward a little he fell on the ground, and prayed that if it was possible the hour might pass away from him;

verses.text: And going forward a little he fell on the ground, and prayed that if it was possible the hour might pass away from him;

sinaiticus.text: And he said: Abba, Father, all things are possible for thee; remove this cup from me: yet not what I will, but what thou.

verses.text: And he said: Abba, Father, all things are possible for thee; remove this cup from me: yet not what I will, but what thou.

sinaiticus.text: And he comes and finds them sleeping, and says to Peter: Simon, sleepest thou? hadst thou not strength to watch one hour?

verses.text: And he comes and finds them sleeping, and says to Peter: Simon, sleepest thou? hadst thou not strength to watch one hour?

sinaiticus.text: Watch and pray, lest you enter into I temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

verses.text: Watch and pray, lest you enter into I temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

sinaiticus.text: And again he went away and prayed, saying the same word.

verses.text: And again he went away and prayed, saying the same word.

sinaiticus.text: And he returned and found them sleeping again; for their eyes were heavy; and they knew not what they should answer him.

verses.text: And he returned and found them sleeping again; for their eyes were heavy; and they knew not what they should answer him.

sinaiticus.text: And he comes the third time and says to them: Sleep the remaining time, and rest; it is enough; the hour has come: behold, the Son of man is delivered into the hands of sinners.

verses.text: And he comes the third time and says to them: Sleep the remaining time, and rest; it is enough; the hour has come: behold, the Son of man is delivered into the hands of sinners.

sinaiticus.text: Rise, let us go: behold, he that delivers me up is at hand.

verses.text: Rise, let us go: behold, he that delivers me up is at hand.

sinaiticus.text: And immediately while he was yet speaking, comes Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the scribes and elders.

verses.text: And immediately while he was yet speaking, comes Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the scribes and elders.

sinaiticus.text: But he that delivered him up had given them a sign, saying: Whomever I shall kiss, he it is: hold him fast, and lead him away securely.

verses.text: But he that delivered him up had given them a sign, saying: Whomever I shall kiss, he it is: hold him fast, and lead him away securely.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had come he immediately came forward and said to him: Rabbi, and kissed him;

verses.text: And when he had come he immediately came forward and said to him: Rabbi, and kissed him;

sinaiticus.text: And they laid hands on him and held him fast.

verses.text: And they laid hands on him and held him fast.

sinaiticus.text: But some one of those standing by drew a sword, and smote the servant of the chief priest, and cut off his ear.

verses.text: But some one of those standing by drew a sword, and smote the servant of the chief priest, and cut off his ear.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: As against a robber you

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: As against a robber you

sinaiticus.text: Daily was I with you in the temple teaching, and you did not lay hold on me; but that the scriptures might be fulfilled.

verses.text: Daily was I with you in the temple teaching, and you did not lay hold on me; but that the scriptures might be fulfilled.

sinaiticus.text: And all left him and fled.

verses.text: And all left him and fled.

sinaiticus.text: And one, a young man, followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around his naked body; and they laid hold of him;

verses.text: And one, a young man, followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around his naked body; and they laid hold of him;

sinaiticus.text: But he left the linen cloth and fled naked.

verses.text: But he left the linen cloth and fled naked.

sinaiticus.text: And they led Jesus away to the chief priests; and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes came together.

verses.text: And they led Jesus away to the chief priests; and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes came together.

sinaiticus.text: And Peter followed him at a distance, till within the court of the chief priests; and he was sitting with the attendants, and warming himself at the fire.

verses.text: And Peter followed him at a distance, till within the court of the chief priests; and he was sitting with the attendants, and warming himself at the fire.

sinaiticus.text: And the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrim sought testimony against Jesus, to put him to death, and found none;

verses.text: And the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrim sought testimony against Jesus, to put him to death, and found none;

sinaiticus.text: For many testified falsely against him, and their testimony did not agree.

verses.text: For many testified falsely against him, and their testimony did not agree.

sinaiticus.text: And some arose and testified falsely against him, saying:

verses.text: And some arose and testified falsely against him, saying:

sinaiticus.text: We heard him say that I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days build another made without hands.

verses.text: We heard him say that I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days build another made without hands.

sinaiticus.text: And not even thus did their testimony agree.

verses.text: And not even thus did their testimony agree.

sinaiticus.text: And the chief priest arose in the midst and asked Jesus, saying: Answerest thou nothing? What do these testify against thee?

verses.text: And the chief priest arose in the midst and asked Jesus, saying: Answerest thou nothing? What do these testify against thee?

sinaiticus.text: But he was silent and answered nothing. Again the chief priest asked him and said to him: Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?

verses.text: But he was silent and answered nothing. Again the chief priest asked him and said to him: Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said: I am; and you shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.

verses.text: And Jesus said: I am; and you shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.

sinaiticus.text: And the chief priest rent his clothes and said: What further need have we of witnesses?

verses.text: And the chief priest rent his clothes and said: What further need have we of witnesses?

sinaiticus.text: You have heard the blasphemy: what think you? And they all condemned him to be worthy of death.

verses.text: You have heard the blasphemy: what think you? And they all condemned him to be worthy of death.

sinaiticus.text: And some began to spit upon him, and to cover his face, and to strike him with the fist, and say to him: Prophesy; and the attendants, striking him with the open hand, took him into custody.

verses.text: And some began to spit upon him, and to cover his face, and to strike him with the fist, and say to him: Prophesy; and the attendants, striking him with the open hand, took him into custody.

sinaiticus.text: And while Peter was below in the court, there came one of the maidservants of the chief priest,

verses.text: And while Peter was below in the court, there came one of the maidservants of the chief priest,

sinaiticus.text: And seeing Peter warming himself, she looked on him and said: Thou also wast with Jesus the Nazarene.

verses.text: And seeing Peter warming himself, she looked on him and said: Thou also wast with Jesus the Nazarene.

sinaiticus.text: But he denied, saying: I neither know nor understand what thou sayest. And he went forth without into the entrance, and a cock crew.

verses.text: But he denied, saying: I neither know nor understand what thou sayest. And he went forth without into the entrance, and a cock crew.

sinaiticus.text: And the maidservant saw him and began again to say to those standing by: This man is of them.

verses.text: And the maidservant saw him and began again to say to those standing by: This man is of them.

sinaiticus.text: But he again denied. And after a little while again they that stood by said to Peter: Truly thou art of them; for thou art a Galilean.100

verses.text: But he again denied. And after a little while again they that stood by said to Peter: Truly thou art of them; for thou art a Galilean.100

sinaiticus.text: But he began to call down curses on himself, and to swear: I know not this man of whom you speak.

verses.text: But he began to call down curses on himself, and to swear: I know not this man of whom you speak.

sinaiticus.text: And immediately a second time a cock crew. And Peter remembered the word as Jesus spoke to him: Before a cock shall have crowed twice, thou shalt deny me three times. And when he thought on it he wept.

verses.text: And immediately a second time a cock crew. And Peter remembered the word as Jesus spoke to him: Before a cock shall have crowed twice, thou shalt deny me three times. And when he thought on it he wept.

sinaiticus.text: And immediately in the morning, the chief priests, with the elders and the scribes, and the whole Sanhedrim having prepared counsel, bound Jesus and led him away, and delivered him to Pilate.

verses.text: And immediately in the morning, the chief priests, with the elders and the scribes, and the whole Sanhedrim having prepared counsel, bound Jesus and led him away, and delivered him to Pilate.

sinaiticus.text: And Pilate asked him: Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered and said to him: Thou sayest.

verses.text: And Pilate asked him: Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered and said to him: Thou sayest.

sinaiticus.text: And the chief priests accused him of many things.

verses.text: And the chief priests accused him of many things.

sinaiticus.text: And Pilate again asked him: Answerest thou nothing? See of how many things they accuse thee,

verses.text: And Pilate again asked him: Answerest thou nothing? See of how many things they accuse thee,

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus no longer answered any thing: so that Pilate wondered.

verses.text: But Jesus no longer answered any thing: so that Pilate wondered.

sinaiticus.text: But at every feast he released to them one prisoner whom they chose.

verses.text: But at every feast he released to them one prisoner whom they chose.

sinaiticus.text: And there was one called Barabbas bound with the insurgents who, in the insurrection, had committed murder.

verses.text: And there was one called Barabbas bound with the insurgents who, in the insurrection, had committed murder.

sinaiticus.text: And the multitude coming up began to ask that he would do as he was accustomed to do for them.

verses.text: And the multitude coming up began to ask that he would do as he was accustomed to do for them.

sinaiticus.text: And Pilate answered them, saying: Will you that I release to you the King of the Jews?

verses.text: And Pilate answered them, saying: Will you that I release to you the King of the Jews?

sinaiticus.text: For he knew that because of envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

verses.text: For he knew that because of envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

sinaiticus.text: But the chief priests instigated the multitude that he should rather release Barabbas to them.

verses.text: But the chief priests instigated the multitude that he should rather release Barabbas to them.

sinaiticus.text: And Pilate again answered and said to them: What then will you that I shall do with him whom you call King of the Jews?

verses.text: And Pilate again answered and said to them: What then will you that I shall do with him whom you call King of the Jews?

sinaiticus.text: They again cried out: Crucify him.

verses.text: They again cried out: Crucify him.

sinaiticus.text: But Pilate said to them: Why, what evil has he done? But they cried out vehemently: Crucify him.

verses.text: But Pilate said to them: Why, what evil has he done? But they cried out vehemently: Crucify him.

sinaiticus.text: And Pilate, willing to satisfy the multitude, released to them Barabbas, and delivered Jesus, after he had scourged him, to be crucified.

verses.text: And Pilate, willing to satisfy the multitude, released to them Barabbas, and delivered Jesus, after he had scourged him, to be crucified.

sinaiticus.text: And the soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Pretorium, and called together the whole band.

verses.text: And the soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Pretorium, and called together the whole band.

sinaiticus.text: And they clothed him in purple, and having plaited a crown of thorns they put it on him:

verses.text: And they clothed him in purple, and having plaited a crown of thorns they put it on him:

sinaiticus.text: And they struck his head with a reed, and spit upon him, and bowing the knees they worshipped him.

verses.text: And they struck his head with a reed, and spit upon him, and bowing the knees they worshipped him.

sinaiticus.text: And when they had derided him, they took off from him the purple, and put on him his own clothes. And they led him out to crucify him,

verses.text: And when they had derided him, they took off from him the purple, and put on him his own clothes. And they led him out to crucify him,

sinaiticus.text: And they impressed one, Simon a Cyrenian, as he passed by coming from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.

verses.text: And they impressed one, Simon a Cyrenian, as he passed by coming from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.

sinaiticus.text: And they bring him to the place Golgotha, which is, when translated, the place of a skull.

verses.text: And they bring him to the place Golgotha, which is, when translated, the place of a skull.

sinaiticus.text: And they gave him wine mingled with myrrh; but he did not receive it.

verses.text: And they gave him wine mingled with myrrh; but he did not receive it.

sinaiticus.text: And they crucified him, and divided his garments among them, casting a lot on them what each should take.

verses.text: And they crucified him, and divided his garments among them, casting a lot on them what each should take.

sinaiticus.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

verses.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

sinaiticus.text: And the superscription of his accusation written on him was, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.text: And the superscription of his accusation written on him was, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

sinaiticus.text: And with him they crucify two robbers, one on his right and one on his left.

verses.text: And with him they crucify two robbers, one on his right and one on his left.

sinaiticus.text: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads and saying: Aha, thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days,

verses.text: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads and saying: Aha, thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days,

sinaiticus.text: Save thyself by coming down from the cross.

verses.text: Save thyself by coming down from the cross.

sinaiticus.text: In like manner also the chief priests deriding among themselves with the scribes said: Others he saved, himself he cannot save.

verses.text: In like manner also the chief priests deriding among themselves with the scribes said: Others he saved, himself he cannot save.

sinaiticus.text: Christ the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reproached him.

verses.text: Christ the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reproached him.

sinaiticus.text: And when the sixth hour had come, there came a darkness over the whole land till the ninth hour.

verses.text: And when the sixth hour had come, there came a darkness over the whole land till the ninth hour.

sinaiticus.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice: Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthanei, which is, translated: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

verses.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice: Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthanei, which is, translated: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

sinaiticus.text: And some of those that stood by, hearing it, said: Lo, he calls for Elijah.

verses.text: And some of those that stood by, hearing it, said: Lo, he calls for Elijah.

sinaiticus.text: But someone ran and filled a sponge with vinegar, and putting it on a reed, gave him to drink, saying: Wait, let us see if Elijah is coming to take him down.

verses.text: But someone ran and filled a sponge with vinegar, and putting it on a reed, gave him to drink, saying: Wait, let us see if Elijah is coming to take him down.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus having uttered a loud cry expired.

verses.text: But Jesus having uttered a loud cry expired.

sinaiticus.text: And the veil of the temple was rent in two from top to bottom.

verses.text: And the veil of the temple was rent in two from top to bottom.

sinaiticus.text: And the centurion that stood by opposite to him, seeing that he thus expired, said: Truly this man was the Son of God.102

verses.text: And the centurion that stood by opposite to him, seeing that he thus expired, said: Truly this man was the Son of God.102

sinaiticus.text: And there were women also looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger, and the mother of Jesus, and Salome;

verses.text: And there were women also looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger, and the mother of Jesus, and Salome;

sinaiticus.text: Who, when he was in Galilee, followed him and ministered to him; and many others came up with him to Jerusalem.

verses.text: Who, when he was in Galilee, followed him and ministered to him; and many others came up with him to Jerusalem.

sinaiticus.text: And evening having now come, because it was the preparation, which is sabbath-eve,

verses.text: And evening having now come, because it was the preparation, which is sabbath-eve,

sinaiticus.text: Came Joseph who was of Arimathea, an honorable counselor, who also himself was looking for the kingdom of God, and went in boldly to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.

verses.text: Came Joseph who was of Arimathea, an honorable counselor, who also himself was looking for the kingdom of God, and went in boldly to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: But Pilate wondered if he were already dead; and calling to him the centurion, he inquired if he had been dead any time;

verses.text: But Pilate wondered if he were already dead; and calling to him the centurion, he inquired if he had been dead any time;

sinaiticus.text: And learning from the centurion, he gave the corpse to Joseph.

verses.text: And learning from the centurion, he gave the corpse to Joseph.

sinaiticus.text: And he bought linen, took him down, wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulcher that had been hewed out of a rock, and rolled a stone to the door of the sepulcher.

verses.text: And he bought linen, took him down, wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulcher that had been hewed out of a rock, and rolled a stone to the door of the sepulcher.

sinaiticus.text: And Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of Jesus saw where he was laid. Mark 16a

verses.text: And Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of Jesus saw where he was laid. Mark 16a

sinaiticus.text: And when the sabbath had passed, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.

verses.text: And when the sabbath had passed, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.

sinaiticus.text: And very early on the first of the week they came to the sepulcher, the sun having risen.

verses.text: And very early on the first of the week they came to the sepulcher, the sun having risen.

sinaiticus.text: And they said among themselves: Who shall roll away for us the stone from the door of the sepulcher?

verses.text: And they said among themselves: Who shall roll away for us the stone from the door of the sepulcher?

sinaiticus.text: And looking up they see that the stone had been rolled away; for it was very great.

verses.text: And looking up they see that the stone had been rolled away; for it was very great.

sinaiticus.text: And they entered the sepulcher and saw a young man, sitting at the right side, clothed in a white robe; and they were amazed.

verses.text: And they entered the sepulcher and saw a young man, sitting at the right side, clothed in a white robe; and they were amazed.

sinaiticus.text: But he says to them: Be not amazed. You seek Jesus the Nazarene who was crucified; he has risen, he is not here: see the place where they laid him.

verses.text: But he says to them: Be not amazed. You seek Jesus the Nazarene who was crucified; he has risen, he is not here: see the place where they laid him.

sinaiticus.text: But go, tell his disciples, especially Peter, that he goes before you into Galilee: there you shall see him, as he said to you.

verses.text: But go, tell his disciples, especially Peter, that he goes before you into Galilee: there you shall see him, as he said to you.

sinaiticus.text: And going out they fled from the sepulcher; for trembling and astonishment had seized them; and they said nothing to any one, for they were afraid. Note: According to Tischendorf, the remaining twelve verses were not learned reader can see the proof as given by Tischendorf. See, also, The Longer Recension of Mark According to the American Standard Version (1901) Mark 16b

sinaiticus.text: . Now when he was risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

verses.text: . Now when he was risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

sinaiticus.text: . She went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

verses.text: . She went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

sinaiticus.text: . And they, when they heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, disbelieved.

verses.text: . And they, when they heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, disbelieved.

sinaiticus.text: . And after these things he was manifested in another form unto two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.

verses.text: . And after these things he was manifested in another form unto two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.

sinaiticus.text: . And they went away and told it unto the rest: neither believed they them.

verses.text: . And they went away and told it unto the rest: neither believed they them.

sinaiticus.text: . And afterward he was manifested unto the eleven themselves as they sat at meat; and he upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them that had seen him after he was risen.

verses.text: . And afterward he was manifested unto the eleven themselves as they sat at meat; and he upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them that had seen him after he was risen.

sinaiticus.text: . And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to the whole creation.

verses.text: . And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to the whole creation.

sinaiticus.text: . He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that disbelieveth shall be condemned.

verses.text: . He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that disbelieveth shall be condemned.

sinaiticus.text: . And these signs shall accompany them that believe: in my name shall they cast out demons; they shall speak with new tongues;

verses.text: . And these signs shall accompany them that believe: in my name shall they cast out demons; they shall speak with new tongues;

sinaiticus.text: . they shall take up serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall in no wise hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.

verses.text: . they shall take up serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall in no wise hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.

sinaiticus.text: . So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken unto them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

verses.text: . So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken unto them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

sinaiticus.text: . And they went forth, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.104
